div.p: This case-sensitive code system https://mitre.org/fhir/space-health/CodeSystem/space-visual-effects-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: A constellation of ocular and brain findings in astronauts exposed to long-duration spaceflight, including optic disc edema, globe flattening, choroidal folds, and hyperopic shifts
Swelling of the optic disc observed in astronauts during long-duration spaceflight
Flattening of the posterior portion of the eye globe observed in astronauts during spaceflight
Folds in the choroidal layer of the eye observed in astronauts during spaceflight
A shift toward farsightedness observed in astronauts during spaceflight
Cataracts resulting from exposure to space radiation
Visual perception of flashes of light caused by cosmic rays interacting with the retina or visual cortex
Changes in the blood vessels of the retina observed during spaceflight

description.value: CodeSystem for space visual effects not found in SNOMED CT

definition.value: A constellation of ocular and brain findings in astronauts exposed to long-duration spaceflight, including optic disc edema, globe flattening, choroidal folds, and hyperopic shifts
